intro: Eremosis standleyi, commonly known as the Sierra Madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Eremosis standleyi is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
